post: Congratulations to Anna Kunkel, the MyImpact Challenge Grand Prize Winner from the Seven Hills School in Cincinnati, OH! Anna's Student Alliance for Immigrants and Refugees (SAIR) service project helps immigrants and refugees in Cincinnati with English education through initiatives like welcome letters, baskets, and writing contests. Curious to know more about Anna's inspiring project? Read more about her journey and the impact she's making in our community here,  https://lnkd.in/e9qHaPtN.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we are proud to partner with organizations and companies that support civic educationand Federal Flags, LLC wants to give back to the same cause you support. Interested in purchasing an all-American made flag before the Fourth? Just make a purchase through Federal Flags using the code 'BRI,' and Federal Flags will donate a portion of each sale to support the Bill of Rights Institute and civic education. Plus, when you use the code 'BRI' at checkout, you will enjoy an additional 5% off on any already-discounted Federal Flags product. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eFFbmjbM.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #americanflag

Help us find the Bill of Rights Institute National Civics Teacher of the Year! Do you know a civics teacher who is making a real difference in the classroom? Who goes the extra mile to help students learn about our country, government, and Founding principles? You could help us find our Bill of Rights Institute National Civics Teacher of the Year! The National Civics Teacher of the Year will earn national recognition and a $5,000 prize. Educators, students, parents, and community members can submit nominations right on our website:  https://lnkd.in/eeyPqeMM  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #NationalCivicsTeacheroftheYear

Utah students had the opportunity to hear from top-notch speakers, showcase their civic engagement skills, and compete for $5,000 in prizes at the Utah MyImpact Challenge Youth Leadership Workshop. MyImpact Challenge is a national contest hosted by the Bill of Rights Institute where students develop constitutionally-principled civic engagement projects. Hosted on June 14 at the Utah Valley University campus in Orem, the Utah MyImpact Challenge Youth Leadership Workshop represented a collaboration among the Bill of Rights Institute, the Center for Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University, the Utah Civic Learning Collaborative, and Youthlinc. Students participated in a day of civic education and leadership programming, and had an opportunity to demonstrate their MyImpact Challenge projects. To learn more, visit  https://lnkd.in/eQ6ZP_aF  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Flag Day commemorates the adoption of the United States flag on June 14, 1777. Meet Elizabeth Hancox, our programs intern! Lizzie joined the Bill of Rights Institute as a Programs Intern in February 2023. She is excited to return this summer to continue assisting with BRIs mission to elevate civic education across the United States. As a Programs Intern, she assists with BRIs various forms of programming, including professional development seminars, colloquia, conferences, and student programs such as Student Fellowship. Lizzie studies History and Political Science at George Washington University and is passionate about early American history.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #internship

The Bill of Rights Institute is honored to introduce the James Madison Legacy Society, a new gift planning opportunity. Planned giving is a meaningful way to leave a legacy that will support our young people  and shape the future of civic education  for generations to come. BRI's Director of Strategic Partnerships, Jennifer Seal, explains more about the James Madison Legacy Society and her personal commitment to the effort. To learn more, please watch the video below or visit  https://lnkd.in/e9qDssKY. For more information, visit supportbri.org.  #billofrightsinstitute  #plannedgiving  #jamesmadisonlegacysociety

We would like to thank Your Bindery for its generous donation and support for the Bill of Rights Institutes The Power of the Printed Word campaign. The Power of the Printed Word campaign is BRIs effort to provide pocket copies of the U. S. Constitution to teachers and students nationwide. Supporters like Luann Wood @YBF help make these important initiatives possible. To learn more about our resources and programsand to see how to support the Bill of Rights Institutevisit www.mybri.org.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

Today, June 6, 2024, marks the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings along the Normandy coast during World War II. You are about to embark upon a great crusade, toward which we have striven these many months. The eyes of the world are upon you. . . . I have full confidence in your devotion to duty and skill in battle. We will accept nothing less than full Victory," Dwight D. Eisenhower dispatched to the troops before they landed. To commemorate this historic day, check out our playlist of D-Day resources, here  https://lnkd.in/emn8WG8B Or watch our Heroes & Villains video, here  https://lnkd.in/eK-jwBWx  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #DDay

Students across the state of Ohio will now have their own copies of Americas founding documents, thanks to the generosity of two businesses in the state. Cleveland-based Foote Printing Inc. and BINDTECH, which operates a plant in Macedonia, OH, have donated more than 13,500 pocket-sized constitutions for use in Ohio classrooms. The companies donated paper, printing, binding, and finishing services as part of the Bill of Rights Institutes The Power of the Printed Word campaign. "I believe a good understanding of the United States Constitution is paramount for creating the civic-minded leaders the USA needs now and in the future,  said Foote Printing co-owner Michael Duhr. To read more, visit  https://lnkd.in/eJnFpQYU  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #poweroftheprintedword
